item.title: Making a Jaggrab crc file
item.dc:creator: @silabsoft RuneAgent
item.description:
@silabsoft wrote:

As you may know if you’re interested in the jaggrab server you need to make a crc file. Although not a very difficult concept some have asked what the deal with the hash is.

here is how i choose to make the crc file, the hash is ripped right out of the clients crc read process.

    public byte[] createCRC() {
        StreamWriter temp = new StreamWriter();
        for (int i1 = 0; i1 < 9; i1++)
            temp.addInt(expectedCRCs[i1]);

        int hash = 1234;
        for (int i = 0; i < 9; i++) {
            hash = (hash << 1) + expectedCRCs[i];
        }
        temp.addInt(hash);
        return temp.getPayload();
    }

[code]package com.silabsoft;

/**

  • Created by Silabsoft

  • Date: Sep 15, 2008

  • Time: 2:47:06 AM
    */
    public class StreamWriter {

    public StreamWriter() {
    this(0);
    }

    public StreamWriter(int capacity) {
    payload = new byte[capacity];
    }

    private byte[] payload;
    private int curLength;

    private void expandCapacity(int minimumCapacity) {
    int newCapacity = (payload.length + 1) * 2;
    if (newCapacity < 0) {
    newCapacity = Integer.MAX_VALUE;
    } else if (minimumCapacity > newCapacity) {
    newCapacity = minimumCapacity;
    }
    byte[] newPayload = new byte[newCapacity];
    try {
    while (curLength > payload.length)
    curLength–;
    System.arraycopy(payload, 0, newPayload, 0, curLength);
    } catch (Exception e) {

     }
 payload = newPayload;

    }

    private void ensureCapacity(int minimumCapacity) {
    if (minimumCapacity >= payload.length)
    expandCapacity(minimumCapacity);
    }

    public StreamWriter addBytes(byte[] data) {
    return addBytes(data, 0, data.length);
    }

    public StreamWriter addBytes(byte[] data, int offset, int len) {
    int newLength = curLength + len;
    ensureCapacity(newLength);
    System.arraycopy(data, offset, payload, curLength, len);
    curLength = newLength;
    return this;
    }

    public StreamWriter addByte(byte val) {
    return addByte(val, true);
    }

    public StreamWriter addByte(byte val, boolean checkCapacity) {
    if (checkCapacity)
    ensureCapacity(curLength + 1);
    payload[curLength++] = val;
    return this;
    }

    public StreamWriter addShort(int val) {
    ensureCapacity(curLength + 2);
    addByte((byte) (val >> 8), false);
    addByte((byte) val, false);
    return this;
    }

    public StreamWriter add3Byte(int val) {
    ensureCapacity(curLength + 3);
    addByte((byte) (val >> 16), false);
    addByte((byte) (val >> 8), false);
    addByte((byte) val, false);
    return this;
    }

    public StreamWriter addInt(int val) {
    ensureCapacity(curLength + 4);
    addByte((byte) (val >> 24), false);
    addByte((byte) (val >> 16), false);
    addByte((byte) (val >> 8), false);
    addByte((byte) val, false);
    return this;
    }

    public int getOffset() {
    return curLength;
    }

    public byte[] getPayload() {
    return payload;
    }

}
[/code]

how to get the crc values: import java.util.zip.CRC32;

            aCRC32_930.reset();
            aCRC32_930.update(data);
            int i1 = (int) aCRC32_930.getValue();
            expectedCRCs[i] = i1;

remember you need to output the file sooooooooo

try { FileOutputStream out = new FileOutputStream("crc-371"); byte data[] = createCRC(); out.write(data); out.close(); } catch (Exception e) { e.printStackTrace(); }
